newsitem.title: USA: Truevision cites Avid sales for shortfall.
newsitem.headline: Truevision cites Avid sales for shortfall.

text.p: Truevision Inc said on Tuesday that fewer shipments of its digital video products to customer Avid Technology Inc led to a first quarter loss that "disappointed" the company.

"Other portions of our business were adversely impacted by delays in new software applications and failed to make up the reductions," the company said in a statement along with its first quarter earnings for fiscal 1997.

Tuesday, Truevision reported a net loss of $0.66 per share for the quarter ended September 29, versus a profit of $0.03 per share one year ago. First quarter fiscal 1997 earnings include a charge of $0.38 a share for an accounting change.
First quarter revenues fell 41 percent to $10 million from $17.0 million one year ago.
